topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539e6ae96368722033fa0500#post_539e6ae96368722033fa0500

They do.

The Two Headed Eagle though is a common symbol in heraldry, sort of like crosses and unicorns. However the Albanian one is black on a field of red, not black on a field of orange.

HRE:
!https://sembrouthes.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/600px-banner_of_the_holy_roman_emperor_with_haloes_1400-1806-svg2.png!

Albania:
!https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6e/Coat_of_arms_of_Albania.svg/501px-Coat_of_arms_of_Albania.svg.png!


EDIT - "This place.":http://forum.legendsofequestria.com/index.php

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539e6ae96368722033fa0500#post_539e6ae96368722033fa0500
The Twin headed eagle is used in many heraldry throughout Europe. The Byzantine Empire, Russia, and other countries mainly in Esater and Central Europe use it.

It's originally a Roman symbol representing the Empire's power over state and church.
